meanings.definition: To provide motivation or encouragement to do something
meanings.sent1: The teacher used a sticker chart to incentivize the students to complete their homework.
meanings.sent2: Companies often incentivize their employees with bonuses for meeting sales targets.
meanings.sent3: The race to the finish line became a fun game of who could incentivize themselves the most.
meanings.sent4: Her smile was like a magical wand, able to incentivize even the most reluctant individuals.
meanings.sent5: The coach's pep talk was so powerful, it could incentivize a team to achieve the impossible.

meanings.definition: To offer rewards or benefits to encourage a particular behavior or action
meanings.sent1: Parents sometimes incentivize their children with extra screen time for completing chores.
meanings.sent2: Supermarkets often incentivize shoppers with loyalty programs and discounts.
meanings.sent3: The idea of a pizza party can incentivize even the laziest of friends to help with moving.
meanings.sent4: Her laughter was like music, able to incentivize a room full of people to join in the joy.
meanings.sent5: The promise of a vacation can incentivize someone to work harder and save money.
